renewable-energy-certificates-subtext: Renewable Energy Certificates (RECs) are a flexible energy product that can help your company decarbonise its footprint and meet regulatory requirement.
renewable-energy-certificates-img-alt: Two employees at a solar power station

renewable-energy-certificates-content-bl.content: Invest in clean energy by purchasing RECs

When alternative green power options are not available locally RECs are a flexible product enabling you to source green energy on a pan-European or global scale, overcome the renewable electricity supply gap and met your sustainability targets.
Meet regulatory and voluntary sustainability targets with RECs

We leverage our trading capabilities and work with renewable energy producers to provide RECs for businesses just like yours. RECs are issued when one megawatt-hour (MWh) of electricity is generated and delivered to the electricity grid from a renewable energy source. You can purchase these RECs either as a stand-alone product or bundled with energy. Sold, delivered, or purchased separately from electricity, RECs are flexible and cost-effective. They are not tied to an underlying power purchase agreement (PPA) and can come from either a single renewable source or a mix of sources. When purchased alongside electricity from the same renewable source, RECs are less flexible but allow for the option to to claim the purchase of clean energy from a specific project.

Help meet your sustainability targets with RECs verified by Green-e Energy, the global leader in clean energy and carbon credit certification. Green-e Energy offers certified RECs that meet consumer-protection standards set by the Center for Resource Solutions (CRS).

example Energy Europe offers you a variety of renewable energy certificates, which can be used to meet your renewable energy commitments. These include European Guarantees of Origin (GoOs), UK Renewable Obligation Certificates Certificates (ROCs) and UK Renewable Energy Guarantees of Origin (REGOs).

content: Source a variety of certificates according to your needs, from the most basic ones to more advanced eco-labels with additional sustainability features.
Take care of all the administration around your GoOs, ensuring that they are registered, tracked and retired on your behalf in the national registry and providing you with the cancellation statement.
Maintain 100% renewable fuel mix disclosure in the UK by presenting renewable energy certificates to the regulator.

renewable-energy-certificates-content-bl.content: Flexibility to source renewable energy anywhere

Renewable energy certificates document that the energy you consume comes from renewable sources. These certificates provide information on the asset type, location and production date of renewable power and thus make it possible to track and trade renewable electricity.
This is a flexible product, enabling you to source renewable energy on a pan-European or global scale where alternative renewable power options are not available.

renewable-power-subtext: Renewable power is a bundled electricity supply with the renewable energy certificate of your choice.

renewable-power-content-blocks.content: example Energy provides your business with advanced and high-value solutions for energy assets and commodities, including natural gas, power and environmental products, across a broad range of European markets. As part of the global network of example Trading, we are active across all stages of the energy value chain from production, transport and storage to trading, sales and customer service. Our expertise, dedicated services and scale enable us to offer our customers market access and supply, optimisation of energy assets and energy management. We also provide single and cross-commodity solutions, including a growing portfolio of renewable energy sources and voluntary carbon credits.
example Energy Europe, an established power trader and licensed supplier with 15 years of trading experience, can offer you renewable power products.

content: We can source and supply electricity at competitive prices and give you the opportunity to fix and unfix your commodity price before your power is delivered.
You will receive a bespoke renewable power contract and access your invoice and power consumption on the example Energy Customer Portal.
We will guarantee that the volume of your actual power consumption is the same as the retired renewable energy certificates and provide you with the cancellation statement.

renewable-power-content-blocks.content: With our renewable power offering, you can be active in reducing emissions and showcase your commitment to tackling climate change.

Electricity will play an increased role in future energy systems. example is building a significant power business, one that in the future will sit alongside oil, gas and chemicals. We are involved at almost every stage of the process, from generating electricity, to buying and selling it, to supplying it directly to customers. We are expanding our existing electricity business and moving into new areas such as smart grids, distributed generation, domestic and industrial-scale batteries and electric vehicle charging.

5,000 MW+ of renewable power capacity production under management globally, including wind, hydro and solar. We partner with renewable power producers and developers, off-taking both short and long-term electricity from wind and solar plants in the UK, The Netherlands, Spain and Italy.

In Europe we have traded power for almost 20 years, since early liberalisation, consolidating our presence in 14 European power markets and in most of the power exchanges. example has invested in the Blauwwind consortium that will build and operate the Borssele 3 and 4 wind farms off the Dutch coast. example is managing a total installed capacity of 366 MW, enough to power around 825,000 Dutch households.

sustainable-land-asset-enhancement-subte: AiDash ISMS (Intelligent Sustainability Management System) helps you to benchmark and improve your land's Carbon absorption potential along with biodiversity and other natural capital metrics.
sustainable-land-asset-enhancement-img-a: Aerial view of electircity power lines

sustainable-land-asset-enhancement-conte.content: A data-driven approach to manage land

AiDash ISMS platform enables landowners to take stock of the natural capital value of their land assets. Using ISMS, landowners can plan, track and restore the ecosystem for climate protection, carbon absorption and biodiversity net gains.

AiDash is an AI-first vertical SaaS company on a mission to transform operations, maintenance, and sustainability in industries with geographically distributed assets by using satellites and AI at scale. With access to a continual, near real-time stream of critical data, utilities, energy, mining, and other core industries can make more informed decisions and build optimized long-term plans, all while reducing costs, improving reliability, and achieving sustainability goals.
AiDash adds Artificial Intelligence and Satellites in a Project Manager's toolkit

The Intelligent Sustainability Management System (ISMS) is designed to enable large landowners to increase the carbon absorption potential of their land assets by measuring and classifying  their land using satellite and AI image recognition - removing the need for manual ecological land surveys.

The resulting GIS information along with automated environmental calculations are used to establish a natural capital inventory across land estates or multiple site portfolios. Clients typically set enhancement goals aligned with their corporate ESG mission statement and access their data through the secure ISMS web application - a point data repository solution for sustainability land management. ISMS equips clients with the ability to risk assess land developments - balancing benefits across Carbon absorption, biodiversity, pollution removal, community benefits and many other Natural Capital metrics (selected from our library or added as a bespoke metric).

ISMS includes planning, project governance, audit and bespoke reporting features enabling Clients to rapidly create and assess planning options, manage projects per corporate segregation of duties and structures, optimise and monitor enhancement changes at a site/project level and manage performance against targets across their portfolio. We recognise the importance of management/ annual reporting data outputs that come as standard and provide export features for simple transfer to GIS platforms and the Clients sustainability report.

Costs of habitat assessment are 75% less than traditional methods, the risk of human error is removed, and repeatability is ensured with software process automation. Classification quality is benchmarked with professional ecologists, the time to deliver results materially cut and crucially, ISMS provides a whole-estate digital data set in a single easy to use application. Repeat surveys are often requested every 3-5 years and included as part of the software license fee.
Costs vary with the estate scale - for example, ISMS is priced at $20,000/Ha for estates with less than 500 individual locations and a total land area of less than 5,000 Ha.

co2-fleet-emission-compensation-title: Compensate the CO2 emissions of your Fleet
co2-fleet-emission-compensation-subtext: Opt-in to compensate the CO2e emissions from your fleet and help protect natural ecosystems.

co2-fleet-emission-compensation-content-.content: example Fleet Solutions allows you to compensate the carbon emissions from your fuels

The global fleet industry is experiencing rapid changes and significant new challenges. To meet these, and to ensure that countries around the world achieve a fleet mobility system that suits their needs and sustainability aspirations, requires not one solution – but many. These solutions can be categorized into the hierarchy, Avoid through fast, reliable EV Charging, Reduce, through the use of lower emission fuels and finally Compensate. Compensating with the example Fleet Card can play a key role in your decarbonization strategy, allowing you to compensate difficult to avoid carbon emissions in a simple and cost-effective way.

Carbon credits can be generated by nature-based solutions (NBS) as well as projects using other methodologies, such as household devices or small-scale renewable energy, that help to minimise the total amount of greenhouse gas (GHG) in the atmosphere. Nature-based solutions comprise all activities related to the protection or re-development of natural ecosystems such as forests, grasslands, and wetland systems to lower concentrations of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere. This can include avoiding or minimising greenhouse gas emissions and helping to sequester carbon into carbon sinks. Nature-based solutions can in instances also create co-benefits aligned with the UN Sustainable Development Goals, such as strengthening biodiversity, creating food security, and creating sustainable livelihoods.
Compensating the carbon emissions from your fuel

A carbon credit represents the avoidance or removal of 1 tonne of carbon dioxide. These credits are traded among governments and businesses. To ensure the quality and integrity of carbon credits, there is a robust program of third-party standards, verification processes and registries. For customers who fill up with the example Fleet Card, customers will pay a small fee to compensate the lifecycle carbon emissions of their fleet, this means all emissions for example Fleet Card users will be compensated.

The example Card allows you to access a large network of sites in many countries across the globe with world-class on-site facilities. The card allows you to manage your fleet in an online portal where you can run performance reports, review transactions, and manage your cards. example Fleet Hub enables you to set up reports to monitor everything from fleet fuel consumption to transactions and exceptions, and you can even get everything emailed to you on a regular basis. Your example Card is the smart solution for cashless payments on the road- and not just for fuel. Use our fleet card to pay non-fuel transactions, such as road tolls with fewer on-board units, VAT Recovery, truck wash and more — all without the need for your drivers to use cash.

By opting in to compensate for the carbon emissions of your fleet, as your drivers refuel at either a example or third-party service the example Card will track your fleet's overall fuel consumption and calculate the associated lifecycle CO₂ emissions. example will purchase carbon credits equivalent to the amount of your fleet's carbon emissions to compensate them through example's global portfolio of CO2 compensation* projects. You will then be issued with an annual retirement certificate confirming that the CO2 emissions of the fuel has been compensated.
There are several advantages to compensating the CO2 emissions of your fleet fuels with example:

content: Annually, you will receive carbon reduction certificate
Your company will demonstrate corporate leadership and strengthen its position
You can begin, or continue, sustainable business practices
You can meet the increasing demands of internal and external stakeholders
Your business can have a positive impact on communities around the world by offsetting through verified projects.

co2-fleet-emission-compensation-content-.content: *CO2 compensation does not imply that there is no environmental impact from the production and use of the product as associated emissions remain in the atmosphere. CO2 compensation is not a substitute for switching to lower emission energy solutions or reducing the use of fossil fuels. example businesses focus first on emissions that can be avoided or reduced and only then, compensate the remaining emissions.

“Carbon neutral” or “CO2 compensated” indicates that example will engage in a transaction where an amount of CO2 equivalent to the value of the remaining CO2e emissions associated with the [raw material extraction, transport, production, distribution] [and usage /end-of-life (if Lubricants or other non-energy product)] of the [product] are compensated through the purchase and retirement of carbon credits generated from CO2 compensation projects. Although these carbon credits have been generated in accordance with international carbon standards, the compensation may not be exact.
CO2e (CO2 equivalent) refers to CO2, CH4, N2O.

i6-fuel-management-subtext: i6 are industry leaders, driving efficiency and CO2 reduction within the aviation and transportation sectors with innovative fuel management technologies.

i6-fuel-management-content-blocks.content: Hard-to-abate sectors will require data-driven, innovative approaches to meet their decarbonisation ambitions. By leveraging data to improve efficiency, transparency and sustainability, the aviation industry can make leaps towards carbon-free flying.

i6 offers hardware and software solutions to optimise fuel management in the aviation, energy, defence, and transport sectors. Founded in Hampshire, England in 2013, i6 technology is utilised at over 150 airports globally, including North America, Europe, Africa, Oceania and Asia. Together with investors International Airlines Group (IAG), World Fuel Services, Jet Blue Technology Ventures and example Ventures, i6 provides services to trusted companies such as British Airways, KLM, Virgin Atlantic, and Menzies Aviation, increasing operational efficiency and saving airlines thousands of tonnes of CO2.

i6's cloud-based technology is built with reliability, safety, and security in mind, with an average platform uptime of 99.98%. These products fall under the i6 Biosphere product ecosystem, which encompasses all elements of the i6 offering, enabling end-to-end, data-driven, connected fuel management.
Get complete control over your fuel inventory

i6's solutions enable companies to achieve increased control over their fuel inventory and accounting. Reconcile6TM is their fuel inventory and accounting platform, used to track the movement of fuel across the whole supply chain, including Bulk Storage, Accounting, and Logistics. Through Reconcile6TM, companies can track inbound and outbound deliveries,  assess fuel quality, manage fuel transfers between assets, and keep on top of stock changes through controlling static sales and non-sales stock volumes. Through end-to-end digitisation, companies can track every fuel movement from fuel-farm to aircraft, all in real time.
Full remote visibility over ground fuelling operations

Fusion6TM is an into-plane refuelling management platform, providing companies with full remote visibility of ground fuelling operations by connecting data between airports and airlines. Fusion6TM enables greater operational efficiency and minimised operational costs, real time visibility and overview of into-plane operations, as well as improved safety through the logging of safety processes. Fusion6 is an integrated management platform that can be tailored to meet the specific needs of each company, even including business aviation at private airports. eHandshakeTM - their app-based solution designed for distanced interaction between pilots and ground crew - lets the pilot interact digitally with the refueller. This allows for quicker and paperless refuelling, social distancing, and a 50% reduced risk of over-fuelling.

Providing companies with essential inventory and operational data, Perspective6TM can increase fuel efficiency through providing a real-time view of fuelling operations and stock levels. Companies can manage supply chains using up-to-date information, leading to optimised resource use through a dynamic offering which allows companies to collect and compare data from any location across the world.  Through harnessing the power of Perspective6TM, i6 gives companies the opportunity to develop a deeper understanding of their fuelling data.  Airlines and suppliers can feel empowered by leveraging this data to control global fuel costs at a granular level with Synthesis6TM .Using real time operational data and contract pricing, automatic calculations and validation of costs and fees, and the ability to store all required data and information in one central location, Synthesis6TM makes invoicing and financial control significantly more intuitive and efficient.

renewable-natural-gas-subtext: With its low-to-negative carbon intensity score, RNG can quickly help companies meet their near-term emissions reduction targets.

renewable-natural-gas-content-blocks.content: Lowering costs and emissions by putting waste to work

Renewable Compressed Natural Gas (R-CNG) is a low-to-negative carbon emissions natural gas transportation fuel derived from organic waste like food waste or livestock manure. R-CNG can be used to decarbonize fleet emissions or in a voluntary scenario to offset fossil-derived natural gas consumption for industrial or heating uses.

In 2021, we opened our first renewable compressed natural gas (R-CNG) fuelling site in the USA at our products distribution complex in Carson, California. The R-CNG is sourced from example's portfolio of anaerobic digestion projects. The fueling site at Carson allows example to substantially decarbonise its product movements out of the terminal by providing 100% R-CNG for its contracted hauling company.
Help decarbonise your fleet with R-CNG

The use of RNG in natural gas-fuelled vehicles, either as renewable compressed natural gas offers customers already using these vehicles an attractive alternative for lowering their carbon footprint and meeting their sustainability goals.

With its low to negative carbon intensity score, RNG can quickly help companies meet their near-term emissions reduction targets. Converting biomethane from organic waste into RNG is a proven and reliable process, that captures previously uncontrolled methane emissions from dairy farms and landfills, preventing harmful greenhouse gases from entering the atmosphere.

example's RNG business is uniquely positioned to support corporate decarbonization goals with investments being made both upstream (RNG production) and downstream (R-CNG station dispensing). RNG technology and infrastructure have expanded rapidly over the past decade, and RNG is fungible, fully interchangeable with natural gas from other sources. There are currently more than 22 million natural gas vehicles (NGVs) in use around the world today, with voluntary demand for RNG to enable lower carbon emissions growing rapidly. example is investing heavily in RNG production and distribution in the United States and Canada.
R-CNG meeting the needs of tomorrow

According to the California Air Resources Board, renewable natural gas sourced from dairy manure can result in an approximately 250 percent reduction in life cycle greenhouse gas emissions when replacing petroleum diesel in a heavy-duty application. A large fraction of the savings come from avoided methane emissions when manure is collected for RNG production. Encouraged by government policies, demand for RNG is increasing in transport sectors such as road and marine. Establishing a business in the production and supply of RNG allows example to continue providing customers with the fuels they need, not only today but in the future.
Why make the switch to R-CNG?

R-CNG offers multiple advantages over traditional transportation fuels. It can be used in the same applications as conventional natural gas with no difference in performance. Even better, it provides drastic reduction in emissions compared to fossil fuels, helping companies achieve sustainability goals. This is because of its production process: instead of extracting hydrocarbons from underground, they are recovered from waste that would otherwise be disposed of.
Because of this, uncontrolled methane emissions are captured before they are released in the atmosphere.

Additionally, it provides additional income for dairy farmers and creates valuable byproducts including compost, fertilizer and animal bedding. It should also be noted that R-CNG benefits from government incentives in the United States and Canada.

onsite-renewable-power-generation-subtex: Accelerating the transition to the net-zero carbon grid by generating on-site, low cost, resilient, clean power.

onsite-renewable-power-generation-conten.content: Local Power Generation for a Zero-Carbon Future

Driven by its vision of the affordable, reliable, zero carbon grid of the future, Mainspring is delivering a breakthrough new category of power generation – the linear generator – to leading commercial, industrial, and utility customers to increase their energy resilience, generate cost savings, and meet their sustainability and climate goals.  Customers include Fortune 500 companies like Kroger and Lineage Logistics, as well as utilities like PG&E, Florida Power and Light, and others.  Based in Menlo Park, Calif., Mainspring is backed by top-tier investors.
Affordable, Reliable and Clean Energy Generation

The Mainspring Linear Generator delivers unmatched flexibility for the grid transition, including the ability to switch between fuels like hydrogen, ammonia, and biogas with software, and quickly track and firm renewables with its full dispatchability. Whether deployed as a single unit or as a grid-scale array, the technology is easy to permit and interconnect in any jurisdiction, allowing for broad impact across a wide range of use cases on both sides of the meter.
Increased Flexibility in Commercial and Industrial Applications

Mainspring Linear Generators are designed to flexibly operate to meet your cost savings, sustainably, and resiliency needs.  Full dispatchability and dynamic fuel switching enable you to meet your cost goals today and in the future. With 24/7 load-following, the Linear Generator offerrs primary power operation when needed, even when the grid is down. Economic dispatch is based on real-time pricing, and peak-load shaving allows for a reduction of your demand charge.
Towards an Adjustable, Scalable Grid Infrastructure

For utilities, municipalities, and power project developers, Mainspring's Linear Generators are movable and offer utility-scale performance for any project size.  The low emissions, modularity, and fuel flexibility of Mainspring's products reduces the permitting and stranded asset risks associated with larger generation and transmission projects. With the Linear Generator, companies can meet capacity needs with a distributed network of systems that alleviate congestion constraints, firm renewables, and add local resiliency. Avoid or defer T&D upgrades by placing high-performance, fuel-flexible capacity with precision, and avoid expensive and multi-year system upgrades while charging Electric (EV) fleets.

The Mainspring Linear Generator is the ideal backbone for any microgrid.  With any fuel available, our products can seamlessly integrate with solar, energy storage, and microgrid controllers to provide load balancing while parallel to or isolated from the grid. Be it for shipping ports, data centers, university campuses, municipal infrastructure, military bases, residential communities and a variety of other applications, Mainsprings Linear Generator technology can propel your business towards your net-zero targets.

detect-technology-industrial-efficiency-: Unlock new opportunities for industrial efficiency with a cutting-edge industrial AI platform.
Worker using digital device in factory

detect-technology-industrial-efficiency-.content: Accelerate industrial transformation with enterprise AI

By leveraging this high-precision deep-learning model companies can eliminate risks to people, processes and assets. With help from example Ventures, Detect Technology aims to realise its mission of enabling faster and better operational decision-making using reliable real-time intelligence and actionable insights using visual inputs from cameras and drones. The T-Pulse platform runs on customizable and secure architectures to offer its users reliable real-time intelligence and actionable insights.
Uniting data, workforce, equipment and processes

With an Application Availability of over 99.5%, Detect's solution is trusted and used by some of the biggest enterprises including example, ExxonMobil, Adani Group, Reliance Industries, Vedanta Group, Aditya Birla Group, GAIL, LOTTE, Hindustan Petroleum, Indian Oil, Cipla, and many more.

Manage industrial projects and workforce efficiently. Leverage machine vision, sensors, robotics, and machine learning to control and optimize schedule, and ensure end-to-end HSSE performance. Maintain the health and safety of your assets with automated condition and structural health analysis. Integrate a machine learning-enabled platform with your plant to avoid unplanned downtime, maintain asset integrity, and mitigate damage effortlessly. Secure remote facilities, monitor equipment performance, and ensure the safety of workforce present at site with end-to-end intelligent automation. long-haul-bio-lng-subtext: A fuel with a mature, scalable, and affordable technology and infrastructure.

long-haul-bio-lng-content-blocks.content: The decarbonisation of mobility is one of the fundamental challenges of the energy transition, and this journey is being driven through the application of innovative solutions and emerging technologies. Bio-LNG is the key to unlocking the decarbonisation of the hard-to-abate long-haul transport sector. Nordsol's unique concept liquifies biogas, and offers a clean and safe, advanced biofuel that is widely available at an affordable price. Together with Renewi and example, Nordsol's Amsterdam plant  is the the first bio-LNG production plant in the Netherlands. As the demand for bio-LNG is increasing rapidly, Nordsol is striving to achieve the goal of producing 30,000 tons of bio-LNG per year.

As bio-LNG is made from renewable sources, it is a carbon neutral biofuel. In addition, as a replacement for fossil LNG (Liquefied Natural Gas), bio-LNG offers similar advantages as LNG does versus diesel, including net-zero CO2 emission, lower engine sound, lower nitrogen oxide emission, with significantly less PM (particulate matter) emissions.

As the chemical composition is the same, bio-LNG can be blended at any ratio with fossil LNG. Therefore, it can make use of the LNG fuelling infrastructure that already exists, and which is growing rapidly.

Bio-LNG is a biofuel made by processing organic waste flows, such as organic household waste, organic industrial waste, manure, and sewage sludge. When anaerobic digestion of organic waste occurs, biogas is emitted in the process. The main components in this biogas are methane (CH4) and carbon dioxide (CO2). To make bio-LNG, the methane is separated from the carbon dioxide and other critical components, and then liquefied. This liquefaction, which is very complex, increases the energy density 600 times and makes the biofuel economically viable for long-haul road and maritime transport. The Nordsol bio-LNG technology is also able to capture and liquefy the separated CO2 from the biogas. This bio-CO2 can be used in the industry and displaces fossil CO2. Capturing the CO2 further improves the carbon intensity of the produced bio-LNG, which creates significant additional value to the business case.
Creating value through driving the fuel switch

Biogas producers and consumers alike can achieve more green, social and financial value through the conversion of biogas into bio-LNG. The maritime and road transport sector are under pressure from their customers to become more sustainable, and recognize bio-LNG as the best biofuel to decarbonize the heavy-duty, long-haul transport today. As a result, they are willing to offer attractive prices for bio-LNG. Bringing biogas to the high-value fuel market and capturing the biogenic carbon dioxide can lead to:

content: Minimised CO2 emissions
Long-term financial certainty independent from govenment incentive programs
An opportunity to create a local circle economy, in which biogas produced from local waste is converted into bio-LNG for local transport companies

solar-solution-subtext: Cut emissions and costs with accessible and affordable solar energy, with expert guidance from beginning to end.

solar-solution-content-blocks.content: Save today, and help build a sustainable world for tomorrow

Harness the power of solar energy today with solar solutions tailored to the needs of your business. With expert assistance throughout every step of the process, from consultation to implementation, Enie.nl offers an opportunity to save planet and pocket alike.

Since 2013 Enie.nl has provided over 20,000 customers with high-end, accessible energy solutions in the Netherlands, Belgium, and South Africa. With help from example Ventures, Enie is excelling in its mission to harness the potential of clean solar energy by making affordable, climate-neutral, and decentralised energy as accessible as possible.

Through replacing fossil fuel-based energy means with solar, businesses see their energy bills drop significantly along with their Co2 emissions. Enie.nl estimates that with 10 solar panels, you can expect to see €800 per annum, and this savings estimate is expected to increase with soaring traditional energy costs. Enie.nl estimates that an installation of 16 350 Wp solar panels could save 1.8t C02 Per year, approximately equating to an average car driving 10,000 kilometres.

If you don't want to install panels, you can lease solar panels for carefree energy generation with no upfront investment. Businesses pay a fixed monthly amount for energy generated. Through Enie.nl's Yield Guarantee businesses are reimbursed for any extra charge, and after 10 years the solar panels become under the business' ownership.

Enie.nl offers the option for businesses to install the ZonneCarport: a parking, charging and energy generation station in a flexible station. Businesses' fleets can charge with 100% sustainable energy and make optimal use of shaded parking spaces with minimal effort or investment. What's more, employees an rent solar panels through their pay slip through the Green Work Expenses (WKR) scheme, saving costs for employee and employer alike.
Solar Panels on your roof within 12-16 Weeks

Enie.nl's services include expert advice that accompanies an interactive solar panel installation process, tailored to your needs. Your business can feel the benefits of solar generation in 12 weeks, from the initial consultancy phase to the final installation. The process follows 4 steps:

content: Analysis and Proposal - a free introductory meeting is arranged between client and advisor, where the client receives a quote determining how many solar panels can be installed based on aerial photos and electricity consumption.
Purchase Agreement – if the proposal is agreed upon, Enie will draw up a purchase or lease agreement which describes the number of panels, expected yield and next steps.

Contracts and Preparation – Enie solar experts will contact clients to prepare the project for installation. Here, a definitive agreement is signed and the right of superficies is established. This process will be overseen by the project manager who will act as point of contact and keep you informed regarding the progress.

Installation – In the installation phase, Enie arranges everything to initiate the process and coordinates with the client. After completion of installation, the solar panels are connected to the grid and energy is generated from this point onwards.

simulation-technology-subtext: Leverage Akeslos' advanced engineering simulation technology to optimise processes and sustainability throughout your asset's lifecycle.

simulation-technology-content-blocks.content: Optimise Engineering Processes with Breakthrough Tech

Akselos' advanced engineering simulation technology is 1000X faster than legacy approaches, enabling enormous opportunity across the full asset lifecycle. Leverage Akselos' products to optimize your designs at unprecedented scale, run condition-based monitoring, predictive maintenance programs, and safely extend the life of your assets. In collaboration with example ventures, Akselos' Finite Element Analysis (FEA) technology protects multi-billion dollar assets for some of the largest energy operators on the planet.
Protecting your assets with Holistic and Detailed Modelling

Akselos patented algorithms enable fully detailed modeling of entire assets. Akselos' advanced reduced basis modeling technology enables holistic and detailed modeling of large scale and/or highly complex systems, so that engineers no longer need to sacrifice accuracy in order to perform their analysis. Holistic and high fidelity modeling is also the foundation of Akselos' Digital Twin platform - a single model that incorporates the current (as is) and future (as could be) conditions of the asset. Full scale system modeling also allows to the removal of unwanted conservatism from the analysis workflow.

Akselos enables detailed, large-scale models to be solved 100 to 10,000 faster than conventional methods. This enables Akselos Digital Twins to run simulations fast enough to “keep up” with operations, or to run complete standards-based assessments involving thousands of load cases – such as full spectral fatigue analysis of an offshore structure in the as-is state – within an hour. This speed is critical during operations so that insights from the Digital Twin can be obtained quickly enough (real time if required) to inform operational decisions.

Akselos physics based Digital Twins are evergreen models of critical assets, that can be driven by sensors. Open cloud architecture allows for seamless connectivity to various data sources and automation of engineering simulations and assessments. Results from live simulations can be accessed on the web via dedicated dashboards, delivered to third party visualization software or connected directly to asset control systems.

Akselos' Digital Twins are based on first principles of physics, which means that the outputs can be used directly within workflows based on engineering standards. Unlike purely data driven approaches, Akselos' simulation technology is fundamentally a physics-based method, which is formulated in terms of the same mesh-based approach as standard FEA. This means that all of the standards for structural analysis that rely on FEA apply directly to Akselos Digital Twins. Akselos software can be used to assess fitness-for-purpose and risk-based inspection of critical assets in full conformance with engineering standards.
